title: Everyday English Course 110
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: What are they trying to do?

answerOptions: She was too tired to answer it
She worked late at the office
The phone was out of order
instances.correctAnswer: The phone was out of order

variables.a: Why didn't the woman answer the phone?
What does the man want to do?
What time will the game be finished?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Look, it's already 8. Jim said he'd be here by 7.
M: Yes, but you know what the traffic is like this time of the evening.
W: He said he is trying not to be late. Why does he always do this? I've had enough this time.
{a}

variables.a: How does the woman feel?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Hello, this is Room 205. What time is the dinner, please?
W: The main restaurant opens at 7 in the evening and closes at 10. Our coffee shop is open 24 hours a day.
M: And what time is it now, please?
W: It's 6 p.m., sir.
M: Thank you.
{a}

variables.a: Where does the dialogue take place?

questionTemplates.text_en:
A: Good morning. Do you have any tickets left for this evening's performance?
B: Let me just have a look. Well, there're a few seats left in the front stalls. How many tickets do you want?
A: Just two.
B: Yes, I can give you two in the third row. They are 39 pounds each.
A: 39 pounds! I see. All right, I'll take them.
B: That's 78 pounds altogether. You can come to pick them up by 6:30.
{a}
